title: Dollar Strength Bucks Inflation Woes
sub_head: Other major currencies fall as dollar climbs amid economic weakness world-wide
body:
Years ago, high U.S. inflation meant a weak dollar. So far, it is different this time, and many on Wall Street are betting it will stay that way.
The dollar is reaching multidecade highs against its trading partners, even with U.S. inflation at its highest level in nearly 40 years. The U.S. Dollar Index, which tracks the currency against a basket of others, is reaching highs unseen since 2002. The greenbackâ€™s climb has sent the euro, British pound and Japanese yen tumbling.
